These competitors have gained traction by launching new models and offering incentives, contributing to Tesla’s slip in overall market share. Despite offering 0% financing, Tesla still faces competition from the broader car market where overall monthly payments for new cars have increased. As the EV market continues to grow, Tesla’s success will depend on its ability to adapt to increased competition, introduce affordable models, and enhance its technological offerings. This heavy dependence on the world's largest automotive market can be positive in times of peace, but can become a curse in the event of a potential trade/political conflict between China and the US/Europe This is especially true if many Chinese customers continue to switch from foreign to local car brands. Additionally, Tesla’s significant market capitalization—often surpassing traditional automotive firms—supports ongoing investment in research and development, reinforcing its leadership position in the electric vehicle ecosystem. Battery technology is crucial to Tesla’s success in the electric vehicle market.
